Callbacks¶

Template callback description

struct imcomm_params¶

Parameters for a given set of weights.

Public Members

comm_type ct = NONE¶

Type of communication done.

Mat error¶

Accumulated error (e.g. from quantization).

El::Int reshape_height = 0¶

If >0, reshape (local) gradients to these dimensions.

El::Int reshape_width = 0¶
int proportion = 32¶

Adaptive quantization proportion.

DataType pos_thresh = 1.0¶

Threshold quantization thresholds.

DataType neg_thresh = -1.0¶
class lbann_callback¶
#include <callback.hpp>

Base class for callbacks during training/testing. The method of each callback is called at a given point during training or testing by the model. Implement whichever ones you care about. Callbacks may be passed a lbann_summary instance, which they can use to log whatever relevant information they need to.

Subclassed by lbann::lbann_callback_check_dataset, lbann::lbann_callback_check_init, lbann::lbann_callback_check_reconstruction_error, lbann::lbann_callback_checknan, lbann::lbann_callback_checkpoint, lbann::lbann_callback_checksmall, lbann::lbann_callback_debug, lbann::lbann_callback_debug_io, lbann::lbann_callback_dump_activations, lbann::lbann_callback_dump_gradients, lbann::lbann_callback_dump_minibatch_sample_indices, lbann::lbann_callback_dump_weights, lbann::lbann_callback_early_stopping, lbann::lbann_callback_gradient_check, lbann::lbann_callback_hang, lbann::lbann_callback_imcomm, lbann::lbann_callback_io, lbann::lbann_callback_learning_rate, lbann::lbann_callback_ltfb, lbann::lbann_callback_print, lbann::lbann_callback_profiler, lbann::lbann_callback_save_images, lbann::lbann_callback_save_model, lbann::lbann_callback_summary, lbann::lbann_callback_timeline, lbann::lbann_callback_timer, lbann::lbann_callback_variable_minibatch

Public Functions

class lbann_callback_adaptive_learning_rate¶
#include <callback_learning_rate.hpp>

Decrease the learning rate by a fixed proportion when validation error stops improving.

Inherits from lbann::lbann_callback_learning_rate

Public Functions

lbann_callback_adaptive_learning_rate(int64_t patience, float amt)¶

Decrease the learning rate by amt if accuracy does not improve for patience epochs.

lbann_callback_adaptive_learning_rate *copy() const¶
std::string name() const¶

Return this callback’s name.

Protected Functions

float global_schedule(model *m)¶

This is called at the end of every epoch to update the learning rate for every optimizer. Adjustments should be made based on the current global learning rate. The returned learning rate will be used to automatically update the current global learning rate.

Private Members

int64_t m_patience¶

Number of epochs to wait for improvements.

float m_amt¶

Amount to decrease the learning rate by.

int m_cur_epoch = -1¶

Current epoch.

EvalType m_last_score = std::numeric_limits<EvalType>::max()¶

Last recorded score.

int64_t m_wait = 0¶

Current number of epochs without improvement.

bool m_adjust_learning_rate = false¶

Whether to adjust learning rate for current epoch.

class lbann_callback_checknan¶
#include <callback_checknan.hpp>

Check matrices for whether they include any NaNs or infs to help debugging. This will kill the rank if such values are discovered.

Inherits from lbann::lbann_callback

class lbann_callback_checksmall¶
#include <callback_checksmall.hpp>

Check matrices for whether they include any very small values to avoid getting denormalized values. Denormalized values can significantly slow floating point computations. Since we often square values, the check is based on the square root of the smallest floating point value. This will kill the rank if such values are discovered.

Inherits from lbann::lbann_callback

Public Functions

lbann_callback_checksmall()¶
lbann_callback_checksmall(const lbann_callback_checksmall&)¶
lbann_callback_checksmall &operator=(const lbann_callback_checksmall&)¶
lbann_callback_checksmall *copy() const¶
void on_forward_prop_end(model *m, Layer *l)¶

Check that activations are good.

void on_backward_prop_end(model *m)¶

Check that gradients are good.

void on_batch_end(model *m)¶

Check that weights are good.

std::string name() const¶

Return this callback’s name.

Private Functions

bool is_good(const AbsDistMat &m)¶

Return true if there are no problems with m.

Private Members

const DataType m_threshold = std::sqrt(std::numeric_limits<DataType>::min())¶

Smallest allowable value.

Protected Functions

float global_schedule(model *m)¶

This is called at the end of every epoch to update the learning rate for every optimizer. Adjustments should be made based on the current global learning rate. The returned learning rate will be used to automatically update the current global learning rate.

Private Members

float m_amt¶

Amount to decrease the learning rate by.

std::vector<int64_t> m_drop_epochs¶

Epochs to drop learning rate at. This is stored in reverse sorted order, so that the end can be examined and then popped in constant time.

class lbann_callback_dump_activations¶
#include <callback_dump_activations.hpp>

Dump activations matrices to files. This will dump each or selected hidden layer’s activation matrix after each minibatch or at the end of an epoch. The matrices are written to files using Elemental’s simple ASCII format. This is not meant for checkpointing, but for exporting acitvation matrices for analysis that isn’t easily done in LBANN. This will be slow and produce a lot of output if matrices are dumped during each minibatch. If list of layers at which to dump activations is provided, activations/inferences will be dumped at the end of testing

Inherits from lbann::lbann_callback

Public Functions

lbann_callback_dump_activations(std::string basename, int batch_interval = 1, std::vector<std::string> layer_names = std::vector< std::string >())¶

Parameters
  • basename: The basename for writing files.

lbann_callback_dump_activations(const lbann_callback_dump_activations&)¶
lbann_callback_dump_activations &operator=(const lbann_callback_dump_activations&)¶
lbann_callback_dump_activations *copy() const¶
void on_forward_prop_end(model *m, Layer *l)¶

Called when a layer ends forward propagation.

void on_test_end(model *m)¶

Write activations/inferences to file on test end.

std::string name() const¶

Return this callback’s name.

Private Members

std::string m_basename¶

Basename for writing files.

std::vector<std::string> m_layer_names¶

List of layers at which to save activations/inferences

class lbann_callback_dump_gradients¶
#include <callback_dump_gradients.hpp>

Dump gradient matrices to files. This will dump each hidden layer’s gradient matrix after each minibatch. The matrices are written to files using Elemental’s simple ASCII format. This is not meant for checkpointing, but for exporting gradient matrices for analysis that isn’t easily done in LBANN. Note this dumps matrices during each mini-batch. This will be slow and produce a lot of output.

Inherits from lbann::lbann_callback

Public Functions

lbann_callback_dump_gradients(std::string basename, int batch_interval = 1)¶

Parameters
  • basename: The basename for writing files.

lbann_callback_dump_gradients(const lbann_callback_dump_gradients&)¶
lbann_callback_dump_gradients &operator=(const lbann_callback_dump_gradients&)¶
lbann_callback_dump_gradients *copy() const¶
void on_backward_prop_end(model *m)¶

Called when a model ends backward propagation.

std::string name() const¶

Return this callback’s name.

Private Members

std::string m_basename¶

Basename for writing files.

class lbann_callback_dump_minibatch_sample_indices¶
#include <callback_dump_minibatch_sample_indices.hpp>

Dump sample indices for each minibatch to files. This will dump the list of indices from the training / validation / testing data that was processed Note this dumps vectors during each mini-batch. This will be slow and produce a lot of output.

class lbann_callback_hang¶
#include <callback_hang.hpp>

Hang LBANN as training starts so debuggers can attach. This will cause either a specific rank (in COMM_WORLD) or every rank to hang. Attach to the hung ranks and set the hang flag to false with a debugger to proceed.

Inherits from lbann::lbann_callback

Public Functions

lbann_callback_hang(int rank_to_hang = -1)¶

Parameters
  • rank_to_hang: The rank to hang; -1 for every rank (default).

lbann_callback_hang(const lbann_callback_hang&)¶
lbann_callback_hang &operator=(const lbann_callback_hang&)¶
lbann_callback_hang *copy() const¶
void on_train_begin(model *m)¶

Hang on train begin.

std::string name() const¶

Return this callback’s name.

Protected Attributes

int m_rank_to_hang¶

The rank that will hang; -1 for every rank.

class lbann_callback_imcomm¶
#include <callback_imcomm.hpp>

Support inter-model communication after each mini-batch to synchronize gradient updates. This optionally supports quantizing the gradient updates before communication in order to reduce bandwidth requirements.

Inherits from lbann::lbann_callback

Public Types

enum comm_type¶

Values:

NONE¶
NORMAL¶

Do no gradient updates.

ONEBIT_QUANTIZATION¶

Simply sum gradient updates.

THRESH_QUANTIZATION¶

Do one-bit quantization.

ADAPTIVE_QUANTIZATION¶

Do threshold quantization.

Public Functions

lbann_callback_imcomm(comm_type ct = NORMAL, lbann_summary *summarizer = nullptr)¶

Initialize with ct being used for all weights.

lbann_callback_imcomm(const lbann_callback_imcomm&)¶
lbann_callback_imcomm &operator=(const lbann_callback_imcomm&)¶
lbann_callback_imcomm *copy() const¶
lbann_callback_imcomm(comm_type ct, std::unordered_set<weights *> weights_list, lbann_summary *summarizer = nullptr)¶

Convenience initialization to do one update type for specific weights. Implies no inter-model updates for other weights.

void set_weights_comm(weights *w, comm_type ct)¶

Choose comm type ct for weights.

void set_weights_adaptive(weights *w, int proportion)¶

Set weights to use adaptive quantization with proportion.

class lbann_callback_learning_rate¶
#include <callback_learning_rate.hpp>

Base class for learning rate schedules. Child classes should implement the schedule method to make changes.

Inherits from lbann::lbann_callback

Subclassed by lbann::lbann_callback_adaptive_learning_rate, lbann::lbann_callback_drop_fixed_learning_rate, lbann::lbann_callback_linear_growth_learning_rate, lbann::lbann_callback_optimizerwise_adaptive_learning_rate, lbann::lbann_callback_poly_learning_rate, lbann::lbann_callback_step_learning_rate

Only apply to specific weights.

Do some initialization.

Apply global learning rate schedules.

void on_backward_prop_end(model *m)¶

Apply local/per-optimizer learning rate schedules.

Protected Functions

virtual float global_schedule(model *m)¶

This is called at the end of every epoch to update the learning rate for every optimizer. Adjustments should be made based on the current global learning rate. The returned learning rate will be used to automatically update the current global learning rate.

virtual float optimizer_schedule(model *m, optimizer &opt)¶

This is called at the end of every training mini-batch to update the learning rate for optimizer opt. The current global learning rate is not updated automatically based on this method.

Protected Attributes

std::unordered_set<weights *> m_weights¶

Weights to update.

Protected Static Attributes

float m_cur_global_lr¶

This should be maintained by all learning rate schedule implementations as the current global learning rate. This enables coordination among different schedules, particularly ones that work on a per-optimizer basis.

class lbann_callback_linear_growth_learning_rate¶
#include <callback_learning_rate.hpp>

Linearly increase the learning rate to reach a target value over a fixed number of epochs.

Note
This currently assumes every optimizer begins with the same learning rate. This also forces its schedule and will stomp over other changes.

class lbann_callback_ltfb¶
#include <callback_ltfb.hpp>

Manage LTFB training. LTFB works in rounds, which are made up of some number of mini-batches (that evenly divide the number of minibatches in an epoch). In each round, the model trains as usual, and at the end it is randomly paired with another model. The pairs exchange their models and evaluate both their local and the received model on their validation data. The model achieving the highest accuracy is retained and training continues. Current limitations:

  • Does not transfer optimizer state, so it’s best to stick to SGD without momentum.
  • Uses the validation data for the tournament (we may not want this).
  • Requires a manually-created model duplicate.

Inherits from lbann::lbann_callback

Public Functions

lbann_callback_ltfb(int round_size, lbann_summary *summarizer = nullptr)¶

Constructor.

Parameters
  • round_size: The number of minibatches in each round.

lbann_callback_ltfb(const lbann_callback_ltfb &other)¶
lbann_callback_ltfb &operator=(const lbann_callback_ltfb &other)¶
~lbann_callback_ltfb()¶
lbann_callback_ltfb *copy() const¶
std::string name() const¶

Return this callback’s name.

void setup(model *m)¶

Set up LTFB.

void on_batch_begin(model *m)¶

Potentially run an LTFB round.

Private Members

LBANN communicator.

int m_round_size¶

Number of minibatches in a round.

Weights from local model.

class lbann_callback_minibatch_schedule¶

Inherits from lbann::lbann_callback_variable_minibatch

Public Functions

lbann_callback_minibatch_schedule(int starting_mbsize, std::vector<minibatch_step> steps)¶
lbann_callback_minibatch_schedule(const lbann_callback_minibatch_schedule&)¶
lbann_callback_minibatch_schedule &operator=(const lbann_callback_minibatch_schedule&)¶
lbann_callback_minibatch_schedule *copy() const¶
std::string name() const¶

Return this callback’s name.

Protected Functions

bool schedule(model *m, int &new_mbsize, float &new_lr, int &ramp_time)¶

Implemented by child classes to provide the mini-batch/learning schedule. This is called at the end of every training epoch. If it returns false, no changes are made from the currently established schedule. If this returns true, the mini-batch size will be changed accordingly. If the mini-batch size is larger than the model’s maximum mini-batch size, a warning is printed and the maximum mini-batch size is used. If new_lr also non-zero, the learning rate will be changed to new_lr, with a linear ramp time. (If ramp_time is 0, it is changed immediately.) Note changing the learning rate while in a ramp may lead to unexpected behavior; also be aware of interactions with other learning rate schedules.

Protected Attributes

std::vector<minibatch_step> m_steps¶

Steps in the mini-batch schedule, stored in reverse sorted order.

class lbann_callback_optimizerwise_adaptive_learning_rate¶
#include <callback_learning_rate.hpp>

This implements an adaptive scheme for adjust each optimizer’s learning rate based on the ratio of the norms of its weights and its gradients. See: You et al. “Scaling SGD Batch Size to 32K for ImageNet Training”, 2017.

Inherits from lbann::lbann_callback_learning_rate

Public Functions

class lbann_callback_poly_learning_rate¶
#include <callback_learning_rate.hpp>

Decrease the learning rate by polynomial policy base_lr*(1 - i_cur/i_max)^p, where base_lr is the initial learning rate, i_cur is the current iteration, i_max is the maximum iteration, and p is a parameter.

Inherits from lbann::lbann_callback_learning_rate

Do some initialization.

This is called at the end of every epoch to update the learning rate for every optimizer. Adjustments should be made based on the current global learning rate. The returned learning rate will be used to automatically update the current global learning rate.

class lbann_callback_step_minibatch¶
#include <callback_variable_minibatch.hpp>

Double the mini-batch size every set number of epochs. Also doubles the learning rate.

Inherits from lbann::lbann_callback_variable_minibatch

Public Functions

lbann_callback_step_minibatch(int starting_mbsize, int step, int ramp_time = 0)¶
lbann_callback_step_minibatch(const lbann_callback_step_minibatch&)¶
lbann_callback_step_minibatch &operator=(const lbann_callback_step_minibatch&)¶
lbann_callback_step_minibatch *copy() const¶
std::string name() const¶

Return this callback’s name.

Protected Functions

bool schedule(model *m, int &new_mbsize, float &new_lr, int &ramp_time)¶

Implemented by child classes to provide the mini-batch/learning schedule. This is called at the end of every training epoch. If it returns false, no changes are made from the currently established schedule. If this returns true, the mini-batch size will be changed accordingly. If the mini-batch size is larger than the model’s maximum mini-batch size, a warning is printed and the maximum mini-batch size is used. If new_lr also non-zero, the learning rate will be changed to new_lr, with a linear ramp time. (If ramp_time is 0, it is changed immediately.) Note changing the learning rate while in a ramp may lead to unexpected behavior; also be aware of interactions with other learning rate schedules.

Protected Attributes

int m_step¶

Number of epochs between mini-batch size increases.

int m_ramp_time¶

Number of steps to ramp the learning rate over.

class lbann_callback_timeline¶
#include <callback_timeline.hpp>

Record a timeline of training runtime on each rank and output it to a logfile for external processing. The logfile is named timeline.m<model-rank>.<rank>.txt. Each line is a separate event, written as name:start-time:end-time. Times are relative to the beginning of training.

class lbann_callback_variable_minibatch¶
#include <callback_variable_minibatch.hpp>

Support changing the mini-batch size on different schedules. Implementations should override implement the abstract methods to define concrete schedules.

Inherits from lbann::lbann_callback

Subclassed by lbann::lbann_callback_minibatch_schedule, lbann::lbann_callback_step_minibatch

Public Functions

lbann_callback_variable_minibatch(int starting_mbsize)¶
lbann_callback_variable_minibatch(const lbann_callback_variable_minibatch&)¶
lbann_callback_variable_minibatch &operator=(const lbann_callback_variable_minibatch&)¶

Set the initial mini-batch size.

void on_epoch_end(model *m)¶

Potentially change the mini-batch size.

Protected Functions

virtual bool schedule(model *m, int &new_mbsize, float &new_lr, int &ramp_time) = 0¶

Implemented by child classes to provide the mini-batch/learning schedule. This is called at the end of every training epoch. If it returns false, no changes are made from the currently established schedule. If this returns true, the mini-batch size will be changed accordingly. If the mini-batch size is larger than the model’s maximum mini-batch size, a warning is printed and the maximum mini-batch size is used. If new_lr also non-zero, the learning rate will be changed to new_lr, with a linear ramp time. (If ramp_time is 0, it is changed immediately.) Note changing the learning rate while in a ramp may lead to unexpected behavior; also be aware of interactions with other learning rate schedules.

void change_learning_rate(model *m, float new_lr) const¶

Change the learning rate of every layer in m to new_lr.

float get_current_learning_rate(model *m) const¶

Get the current learning rate (assumes every layer has the same one).

Protected Attributes

const int m_starting_mbsize¶

Initial mini-batch size.

int m_current_mini_batch_size¶

The current mini-batch size for this epoch. This is kept separately from the model’s get_current_mini_batch_size() method, as calling that in on_epoch_end returns the size of the last mini- batch, not the “base” mini-batch.

int m_ramp_count = 0¶

Current number of epochs left to ramp the learning rate.

float m_lr_incr = 0.0f¶

Amount to increment the learning rate by when ramping.

struct minibatch_step¶
#include <callback_variable_minibatch.hpp>

Represents a step in a schedule of mini-batch sizes.

Public Functions

minibatch_step(int _epoch, int _mbsize, float _lr, int _ramp_time)¶

Public Members

int epoch¶

Epoch for this schedule to start.

int mbsize¶

Mini-batch size to use.

float lr¶

Learning rate to use.

int ramp_time¶

Number of epochs to ramp the learning rate over.

namespace lbann¶

file profiler.hpp
#include “lbann/callbacks/callback.hpp”
group callbacks

Dump weight matrices to files. This will dump each hidden layer’s weight/bias matrix after each epoch. The matrices are written to files using Elemental’s simple ASCII format. This is not meant for checkpointing, but for exporting weight matrices for analysis that isn’t easily done in LBANN.
